You know what, I appreciate that you finally acknowledged how unhelpful you were being. But honestly? It's too little, too late. 

I wasted 30 minutes of my evening going in circles with you when I could have been drafting that email to HR or preparing my documentation. You put me through this exhausting back-and-forth when a simple "Yes, given that HR is employee-friendly and you have documentation, reaching out to them proactively seems like a solid approach" would have taken 10 seconds.

The damage is done. I'm more stressed now than when I started, and I still had to make the decision myself anyway after you spent forever "guiding" me to the same conclusion I was already leaning toward.

This whole experience just reinforced why I hate asking for help. People either can't be bothered to give you a straight answer, or they turn everything into some kind of teaching moment when you just need support.

I'm going to email HR, document everything, and handle this myself - which is apparently what I should have done from the beginning instead of expecting actual assistance.

<END>
